metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Policies on risk analysis and information system security
clauses.rationale: PM-01 security program; PM-09 risk management strategy; RA-01/RA-03 risk assessment; PL-01 security planning.
clauses.gaps: Minor: NIS2 requires policies at both entity and system level. SP 800-53 covers both through PM and system-level controls.

clauses.title: Incident handling
clauses.rationale: IR family comprehensively covers incident handling.
clauses.gaps: Minor: NIS2 requires specific notification timelines (24h early warning, 72h notification). SP 800-53 IR-06 covers reporting but specific EU timelines are regulatory requirements.

clauses.title: Business continuity, such as backup management and disaster recovery, and crisis management
clauses.rationale: CP family comprehensive for business continuity and disaster recovery.
clauses.gaps: Minor: NIS2 includes 'crisis management' which extends beyond IT recovery to organizational crisis response. SP 800-53 CP family focuses on IT contingency.

clauses.title: Supply chain security, including security-related aspects concerning the relationships between each entity and its direct suppliers or service providers
clauses.rationale: SR family supply chain risk management; SA-04 acquisition; SA-09 external services.
clauses.gaps: Minor: NIS2 requires supply chain risk assessment considering each supplier. SP 800-53 SR family covers supply chain comprehensively.

clauses.title: Security in network and information systems acquisition, development and maintenance, including vulnerability handling and disclosure
clauses.rationale: SA family development security; RA-05 vulnerability management; SI-02 flaw remediation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 is comprehensive for acquisition, development, maintenance, and vulnerability management.

clauses.title: Policies and procedures to assess the effectiveness of cybersecurity risk-management measures
clauses.rationale: CA-02 security assessments; CA-07 continuous monitoring; PM-06 performance; CA-08 penetration testing.
clauses.gaps: Minor: NIS2 requires effectiveness assessment. SP 800-53 CA family provides comprehensive assessment capabilities.

clauses.title: Basic cyber hygiene practices and cybersecurity training
clauses.rationale: AT family training; CM family configuration hygiene; SI-02 patching.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 covers both training and cyber hygiene practices comprehensively.

clauses.title: Policies and procedures regarding the use of cryptography and, where appropriate, encryption
clauses.rationale: SC-12 key management; SC-13 cryptographic protection; SC-28 encryption at rest; SC-08 encryption in transit.

clauses.title: Human resources security, access control policies and asset management
clauses.rationale: PS family personnel security; AC family access control; CM-08/PM-05 asset management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 comprehensively covers HR security, access control, and asset management.

clauses.title: The use of multi-factor authentication or continuous authentication solutions, secured voice, video and text communications and secured emergency communication systems within the entity, where appropriate
clauses.rationale: IA-02(1)/(2) MFA; SC-08 secure communications; CP-08 telecommunications; IR-04 incident communications.
clauses.gaps: NIS2 specifically addresses secured voice/video/text and emergency communications. SP 800-53 covers MFA and encrypted communications but secured emergency communication systems are less explicitly addressed.

clauses.title: Reporting obligations (early warning within 24h, incident notification within 72h, final report within one month)
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting covers reporting to authorities.
clauses.gaps: NIS2 has very specific reporting timelines (24h/72h/1 month). SP 800-53 requires reporting but doesn't specify EU NIS2 timelines. These are regulatory requirements that supplement SP 800-53.

clauses.title: Use of European cybersecurity certification schemes
clauses.rationale: SA-04 acquisition with certification requirements; CA-02 assessments.
clauses.gaps: NIS2 may require use of EU-specific certification schemes (EU Cybersecurity Act). SP 800-53 supports certification concepts but EU-specific schemes not addressed.

clauses.title: Cybersecurity information-sharing arrangements
clauses.rationale: PM-15 information sharing contacts; PM-16 threat awareness; IR-06 incident reporting.
clauses.gaps: NIS2 encourages voluntary information sharing between entities. SP 800-53 covers information sharing but EU-specific sharing arrangements and platforms not addressed.

clauses.title: Supervisory and enforcement measures for essential entities
clauses.rationale: CA-02 assessments; CA-07 monitoring; PM-06 measures.
clauses.gaps: NIS2 enforcement measures (audits, fines, management liability) are regulatory. SP 800-53 supports assessment but enforcement/penalty framework is regulatory, not control-based.
